newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch ING group profits surge to record.
newsitem.headline: Dutch ING group profits surge to record.

text.p: Financial services giant ING Groep NV said Thursday that its profits jumped by 25 percent to a record 3.32 billion guilders ($1.8 billion) last year.

The banking and insurance group, which said it would make a modest share offering in the United States, said almost all its banking, insurance and investment activities achieved considerably improved results.
Analysts applauded the results, which were at the upper end of expectations, and ING shares were steady in Amsterdam, defying the downtrend in the Dutch market.
"The strong results achieved in 1996 are in part a reflection of the favourable general economic trends in the countries in which ING operates," the group said.

ING, which rescued the collapsed British merchant bank Barings in 1995, said the consolidation of Barings and Poland's Bank Slaski contributed to a 34 percent jump in commission income and a 22 percent rise in operating spending.
The Dutch group said the excellent stock market climate also boosted commissions and was a factor in a 72 percent surge in securities trading income.

The increase came despite provisions before tax for future expenses, related partly to the cost of the introduction of a single European currency and computer and other changes related to the millennium.
